src package

Submodules

src.core module

This module uses all the “helpers” modules to create ead a fullpartial ready-to-use dataset:

create the following directory tree:

/myDataSet/
/rawData/
/<subjectNmae>/
/compressedRawFiles/

/”adie_C3B_2021-12-13T15.52.14.492_C3B38AD76217_LinearAcceleration.h5” /…

/compressedSyncedFiles/

/”adie_C3B_2021-12-13T15.52.14.492_C3B38AD76217_LinearAcceleration.h5” /…

/sensoresSyncedFiles/

/adie_C3B_2021-12-13T15.52.14.492_C3B38AD76217_LinearAcceleration.h5” /…

/summary/

/<sensor_name1>_LA.txt /<sensor_name1>_Q.txt /<sensor_name1>_LA_Q.txt /both_LA_synced.txt /both_Q_synced.txt /…

Directories

  • /compressedRawFiles/ - this dir contain compressed format of the measurements dataframes(no preprocessing)

  • /compressedSyncedFiles/ - this dir contain compressed format of the measurements dataframes synced for each sensor

  • /sensoresSyncedFiles/ - this dir contain compressed format of the measurements dataframes synced between sensors

  • /summary/ - this dir contain the summary of the timestemps validation summery for each file and the syncing validation between the files timestamp

Summary txt files

  • /<sensor_name1>_LA.txt - sensor1, LA file timestamp validation summary

  • /<sensor_name1>_Q.txt - sensor1, Q file timestamp validation summary

  • /<sensor_name1>_LA_Q.txt - sensor1, LA and Q files syncing validation summary

  • /both_LA_synced.txt - LA files for both sensors syncing validation summary

  • /both_Q_synced.txt - Q files for both sensors syncing validation summary

Functions

1. createOrReadDataSet()- This function do somthing

2. readAndSync()- This function read the csv’s of “quaternion” and “linear_acceleration” measurements and sync them and create a syncing report.

src.core.createOrReadDataSet(path_subject, force_create=False, test=False)

This function do all the high level logic for the linear acceleration and quaternion syncing and save in hdf format.

the function will generate 1 dir, if there arnt exist:

  • ‘subject_name/’sensoresSyncedFiles/’ - contain comressed version of dataframes for all csv files

and will add summary txt files to ‘subject_name/summary/’ dir

Parameters:

  • path_subject (str) – the path of the subject dir .

  • force_create (bool) – will force new file creation if True, default to False .

  • test (bool) – should be set to true if the function is called from unittest default to Fasle

Return type:

None

src.core.readAndSync(pathCSV, pathHDFRaw, pathHDFSynced, path_to_summary, file1, file2, force_creation=False)

This function do all the high level logic for the linear acceleration and quaternion syncing and save in hdf format.

the function will generate 3 dirs, if there arnt exist:

  • ‘subject_name/compressedRawFiles/’ - contain comressed version of dataframes for all csv files

  • ‘subject_name/compressedSyncedFiles/’ -contain comressed synced and coincide dataframes

  • ‘subject_name/summary/’ - contain txt file summarise timestamp validation for each sensor file and for the syncing of the linear acceleration and the quaternion.

Parameters description:

pathCSVstr

the path of the raw csv files .

pathHDFRawstr

the path where to write the dataframes as hdf file, will look like: ‘…compressedRawFiles .

pathHDFSyncedlist of 2 str

the path where to write the dataframes after they been synced(acc and quat) will look like: [‘././rawData/adie/compressedSyncedFilesTest/’adie_C3B_2021-12-13T15.52.14.492_C3B38AD76217_LinearAcceleration.h5’, ‘././rawData/adie/compressedSyncedFilesTest/’adie_C3B_2021-12-13T15.52.14.492_C3B38AD76217_LinearAcceleration.h5’]

path_to_summarylist of 3 str

the path where to write all summary report for each sensor(LA/Q/LA_Q), will look like: [‘././rawData/adie/summaryTest/F9E_LA.txt’, ‘././rawData/adie/summaryTest/F9E_Q.txt’, ‘././rawData/adie/summaryTest/F9E_LA_Q.txt’]

file1str

the csv linear acceleration file name from the ‘raw’ dir,will look like: ‘adie_C3B_2021-12-13T15.52.14.492_C3B38AD76217_LinearAcceleration.csv’

file2str

the csv quaternion file name from the ‘raw’ dir

force_creationbool

if True will create files from scratch even if they exists defult=False

Parameters:

  • pathCSV (str) – the path of the raw csv files .

  • pathHDFRaw (str) – the path where to write the dataframes as hdf file, will look like: ‘…compressedRawFiles .

  • pathHDFSynced (list) – list of 2 str

  • path_to_summary (list) – list of 3 str

  • file1 (str) – the csv linear acceleration file name from the ‘raw’ dir,will look like:

  • file2 (str) – the csv quaternion file name from the ‘raw’ dir

  • force_creation (bool) – if True will create files from scratch even if they exists defult=False

Return type:

None

src.helpers_raw_data_handling module

This module handeles all the low level raw data such as:

  • reading from csv to dataframe

  • syncing diffrent measurements timestamps and validate how synced they are

  • checking measurement and validate the sampling rate and missing samples

  • physical unit conversions

  • save and read dataframes in/from light format ‘hdf’

Functions

1. myCsvToDF(file)- This function read a csv and return a dataframe

2. myDFToHDF(dataframe,path,key=’a0’)- This function get a dataframe and saves it as

3. myHDFRead(path,key=’a0’)- This function read dataframe stored in HDF format

4. checkTimeAxis(dataframe,path_to_summary_txt_file)- This function calculate metrics of the raw data samples: monotonic/mean dt/jumps in ms

5. checkTimeAxisOf2DataFrames(dataframe1, dataframe2,path_to_summary_txt_file)- This function calculate metrics of the raw data samples for how much 2 dataframes are synces: monotonic/mean dt/jumps in ms

6. mySyncingFunction(dataframe1,dataframe2, path_to_summary_txt_file,path_to_dataframes_hdf_files)- This function syncs both hand sensor measurements and back sensor measurements to each other and also linear acceleration to quaternion measurements based on the unix time

src.helpers_raw_data_handling.checkTimeAxis(dataframe, path_to_summary_txt_file)

This function check ‘unix_time’ axis of sensor measurements in order to validate it.

The metrics to evaluate the time-series:

  1. monotonic

  2. list of jumps

  3. biggest jumps

  4. meadn dt

the dictionary keys that will be created to summerize the timestamps, will look like so, if there is no time jumps bigger than ‘TIME_JUMP_THRESHOLD’[ms]:

  • ‘mean dt’

  • ‘monotonic’

  • ‘max_jump’

and like so, if there are time jumps bigger than ‘TIME_JUMP_THRESHOLD’[ms]:

  • ‘mean dt’

  • ‘monotonic’

  • ‘max_jump’

  • ‘jumps list’

  • ‘jumps indeces’

  • ‘max jump list’

  • ‘max jump index’

Parameters:

  • dataframe (pandas.dataframe) – the dataframe we evaluate its time samples

  • path_to_summary_txt_file (str) – the path where to save the summary dictionary if the path is ‘’, the dictionary wont be saved

Return type:

dictionary with calculated metrices

src.helpers_raw_data_handling.checkTimeAxisOf2DataFrames(dataframe1, dataframe2, path_to_summary_txt_file)

This function check ‘unix_time’ axis of 2 diffrent dataframes and how much their unsynced with each other.

the dictionary that will be created to summerize the timestamps, will look like so, if there is no time diffrence bigger than ‘TIME_DIFFRENCE_THRESHOLD’ [ms]:

  • ‘mean dt’:

  • ‘monotonic’:

  • ‘max_diff’:

  • ‘sum_diff’:

and like so, if there are time diffrence bigger than ‘TIME_DIFFRENCE_THRESHOLD’ [ms]:

  • ‘mean dt’:

  • ‘monotonic’:

  • ‘max_diff’:

  • ‘sum_diff’:

  • ‘jumps list’:

  • ‘jumps indeces’:

  • ‘max jump’

  • ‘max jump index’

Parameters:

  • dataframe1 (pandas.dataframe) – the dataframe we evaluate its time samples No 1 this dataframe time will be the referance time

  • dataframe2 (pandas.dataframe) – the dataframe we evaluate its time samples No 2

  • path_to_summary_txt_file (str) – the path where to save the summary dictionary if the path is ‘’, the dictionary wont be saved

Returns:

  • dict (dictionary with calculated metrices)

  • dataframe1_coincide (dataframe1 time_interval which coincide) – with dataframe2

  • dataframe2_synced (elements in dataframe2 which are closest to) – each element in dataframe1_coincide

src.helpers_raw_data_handling.getSensorFilesDictionary(path)

return sensor names contained in a subject raw file.

create a nested dictionary with the keys in the outer dictionary:

  • ‘sensor name1’:

  • ‘sensor name 2’:

and with the keys in the inner dictionary:

  • ‘Linear Acceleration’:

  • ‘Quaternion’:

you could use the output like so:

  • output[‘sensor name1’][‘Quaternion’]–> get the csv full name for sensor name: ‘sensor name1’

and for sensor type: ‘Quaternion’

Parameters:

path (str) – the path to the subjet raw csv files (‘/rawData/adie/raw’)

Raises:

  • Exception – no csv files in dir

  • Exception – missing files in the dictionary(not all 4 there)

src.helpers_raw_data_handling.myCsvToDF(file)

This file convert a ‘file’ string to a correspond data frame with headers.

The dataframes columns and headers will always include:

  • ‘unix_time’,’time’

and for ‘Linear Acceleration’ files will include also:

  • ‘ax’,’ay’,’az’

and for ‘Quaternion’ files will include:

  • ‘qw’,’qx’,’qy’,’qz’

‘unix_time’ type is ‘np.int64’ and all the others ‘np.float32’

Parameters:

file (string) – the path of the file

Returns:

dataframe –

with time and measured values, either :

  • ax, ay, az

or :

  • qw, qx, qy, qz

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

src.helpers_raw_data_handling.myDFToHDF(dataframe, path, key='a0')

This function convert a ‘pandas.dataframe’ object containes the sensors data and convert it to hdf format for fast readwrite operations.

If you supplied key the format will be ‘table’ and data could be added to it, else the format is ‘fixed’ and data could not be added

Parameters:

  • dataframe (pandas.dataframe) – the dataframe to convert and store

  • path (str) – the path to store the data in should be in the form of: “path/to/store/data.h5”

  • key (str) – identifier, will be used maialy for appending to an existing file, in which case you will need to supply a diffrent key for every call

Return type:

None

src.helpers_raw_data_handling.myHDFRead(path, key='a0')

This function read dataframe stored in HDF format.

If you supplied key which is not exist the function wont work

Parameters:

  • path (str) – the path to read the data from should be in the form of: “path/to/store/data.h5”

  • key (str) – identifier, in ‘table’ mode will read to object relevant to key, otherwise will read the only object

Return type:

pandas.dataframe

src.helpers_raw_data_handling.mySyncingFunction(dataframe1, dataframe2, path_to_summary_txt_file, path_to_dataframes_hdf_files)

This function uses other function to syncs 2 diffrent dataframes based on their unix time stamp and save a report about how synced they are and save the synced dataframes in path_to_hdf_file.

The syncing have 3 main reasons:

  1. syncing Quaternion and Linear-Acceleration to rotate it accuratly

  2. syncing rotated Linear-Acceleration of hand sensors and back sensors

  3. get some indications for problematic measurements

Parameters:

  • dataframe1 (pandas.dataframe) – the dataframe which we will use its timestamps

  • dataframe2 (pandas.dataframe) –

    the dataframe that we will find its nearest values

    to the other dataframe timestamps

  • path_to_summary_txt_file ([str,str,str]) –

    1. the file to save the dataframe1 metrics dictionary in

    2. the file to save the dataframe2 metrics dictionary in

    3. the file to save the synced dataframe metrics dictionary in

  • path_to_dataframes_hdf_files ([str,str]) –

    1. the path where to save the dataframe1

    2. the path where to save the dataframe2

Raises:

  • Exception – if datadrame1 had big jumps in the time stamps

  • Exception – if datadrame2 had big jumps in the time stamps

  • Exception – if the 2 dataframes timestamps differ more than ‘TIME_DIFFRENCE_SYNCED_DATAFRAMES’
